Justification: To assess for any fractures, dislocations, or degenerative changes in the cervical spine following the minor fall.
To evaluate soft tissue structures, including intervertebral discs, ligaments, and spinal cord, for any signs of injury or degeneration that might not be visible on an X-ray.

Investigations: CT Scan of the Cervical Spine
Justification: If there is suspicion of a fracture that is not clearly visible on X-ray, a CT scan can provide a more detailed view of the bony structures.
Given the patient's age and history of a fall, it is important to assess bone density to rule out osteoporosis, which could predispose to fractures.
To check for any inflammatory markers that might suggest an underlying inflammatory or infectious process contributing to the neck pain.
